result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:18 PM Defendant Karl C Erstad in court, in custody.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Karl C Erstad.  Attorney Rebekah Rennicke in court for State of Wisconsin. 2:30 PM Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Karl C Erstad.  Prosecuting attorney Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin.    Defense will file a bail motion today, court set for bail hearing with new case coming.   No offer was conveyed by the State.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DLM. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 400 block of Woodvale Dr in Deforest. 
- Defendant shall not be at any residence or workplace of DLM. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any employee of the Deforest School District. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DLM. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 400 block of Woodvale Dr in Deforest. 
- Defendant shall not be at any residence or workplace of DLM. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any employee of the Deforest School District. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

01:36 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
